Rover looks up and sees ... ..- THE DOG CATCHER, his silver net in the air. Before Ro can run away, the net swoops down and scoops him up. The Catcher holds Rover to his face.

dialogues.speaker: DOG CATCHER
dialogues.text: Gotcha, Mongrel! I told you I would. Fortunately, someone left me this anonymous note ... Rover sees the note. Written sloppily, it reads, ‘IF YOU

dialogues.speaker: WANT TO FIND THE MONGRELS IN THE PIAZZA, JUST LISTEN FOR
dialogues.text: WHISTLE.’ Rover looks down at Tyger grinning. He holds up his paws. It is covered in BLACK INK. The gold whistle is still in mouth. The Dog Catcher gallops off with Rover. Benny and Mercury can only watch helplessly as their friend is take away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is jam-packed with stray dogs. When The Dog Cat attempts to shove Rover into one of the already crowded cages, the frightened pup pops right out. The Dog Catcher grabs Rover by a tuft of fur and holds him up to his face

dialogues.speaker: DOG CATCHER
dialogues.text: Well, it looks like it’s your lucky day, poochy. No room at the pound. The Dog Catcher brings Rover close. DOG CATCHER (cont’d) Now what shall I do with you, hmm? I hear in some countries, little doggies are a delicacy. Rover shivers in terror. DOG CATCHER (cont’d) No. You're too small to cook. I have a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mongrels gather around Mama Mongrel as she licks Mercury’s wounds.

dialogues.speaker: BIG DADDY MONGREL
dialogues.text: What the Cat-Pulets did today is an act of war! From this day forth, let no feline feel safe in Verona. The Mongrels are fighting back!  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cat-Pulets gather in the living room. Lady Cat-Pulet licks Tyger’s wounds.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CAT-PULET
dialogues.text: What the Mongrels did today is an act of war! From this day forth, let no canine feel safe in Verona.

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, father. The Dog Catcher took care of the Mongrel that attacked me.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: (Concerned) What was the name of the dog?

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: Rover. How cliché. Juliet is in shock. She turns to Doc.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: (Whispering) I can’t believe Rover would do something like that.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CAT-PULET
dialogues.text: Our mortal enemy has always been the dog. And now you can see why. It’s time The Cat-Pulets fought back! The Cat-Pulets meow in agreement, then follow Lord Cat-Pu out of the room. As Juliet is leaving, she overhears Tyge and his henchcats.

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: It was pretty clever how I made it look like Rover attacked me just as the dog catcher came by. Tyger laughs devilishly. Juliet now knows the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juliet runs in and grabs Doc.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Doc, Tyger set Rover up! My husband is innocent! Go to the pound and tell Rover I know the truth and that I still love him. I just hope he’s all right ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dog Catcher rides just outside the city and drops Rov on a dirt road.  56.

dialogues.speaker: DOG CATCHER
dialogues.text: Hit the road, mutt. You’re banished! And if I ever see your grubby little face again, you'll be meat for my meatballs.

dialogues.speaker: NOW BEAT IT
dialogues.text: Rover starts down the road. The Dog Catcher rides back in the city. The gates slam shut behind him. Rover stops and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere without seeing Juliet one last time ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A furious scratching is heard beneath the earth. After a moment Rover pokes his head out. He’s burrowed his way un the wall and comes out completely covered in mud. He’s ev got dirt in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Patooie! Yeeech! He looks up at the high wall towering above him. ROVER (cont'd) Man, I need to learn to jump. Shaking himself off as best he can, Rover starts off for Cat-Pulets’, but no sooner is he on the road than he sees BLACK HORSE APPROACHING AT A THUNDERING PACE. ROVER (cont'd) Oh no! The Dog-Catcher! Rover leaps from the road and buries himself in a pile of leaves, only to discover that the horse is being ridden b cute little boy. Getting up cautiously, Rover slinks from lamp post to lamp post completely covered in leaves. It looks as though he’s been tarred and feathered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearing the piazza, Rover turns a corner and heads down a street leading to the Cat-Pulets’. Again, we hear a horse approaching. This time it is the Dog Catcher, but Rover h hidden himself in the shadows. The Dog Catcher is more menacing than ever, now wielding whip and striking at any animal in the street.

dialogues.speaker: DOG-CATCHER
dialogues.text: Yee-ah! Yee-ah! The Rats, who are having supper in the alley, are nearly lashed by the whip. After the Dog Catcher is gone, they return to their meal. Rover listens in.  57.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST RAT
dialogues.text: Hey, what’s up with Igor?

dialogues.speaker: SECOND RAT
dialogues.text: Ah, he’s mad about pulling a double shift. Ever since that dumb mutt started the riot in the square.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST RAT
dialogues.text: You mean Rover?

dialogues.speaker: SECOND RAT
dialogues.text: That's his name. You should have heard the Cat-Pulets cursing him when I was up there stealing this cheese. Every one of them! That mutt better not go anywhere near that place, let me tell you. (Gesturing to his plate) Rougefort?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST RAT
dialogues.text: Why thank you. Rover walks away from the rats dejected. Finding a puddle water, he looks at his reflection.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: (To himself) Every one of the Cat-Pulets! Do you think ... Juliet could hate me too? Rover looks up at the Cat-Pulets’ house and ponders for a second. Then he turns and runs down the street in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doc is walking down the street muttering to herself.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: Can you imagine? A cat on the way to the pound? Just think what this will do to my reputation? When she turns the corner, Doc sees Rover sprinting down street still partially covered in leaves.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: (To herself) Rover?! Where you off to in such a hurry? Doc looks down a hill and can see that Rover is heading straight for the cathedral. Sighing, she sets off after h

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: From the pound to the church. Talk about out of your element!  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flyer stands before a mirror combing his hair with dippit hair gel.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Maybe if I part it on the side, nobody will think I’m so... Suddenly, Rover enters the church window and leaps into t belfry.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: (Panting) Flyer? Where are you Flyer? Flyer hides his hair gel and tries to flatten down his ha

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: I’m right here. What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: I’ve been vanished!

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Vanished? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Like from Verona.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Oh you mean “banished”.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Because I got in a fight with Tyger, only it wasn’t my fault, but then the dog catcher came, and he thought it was my fault, but it wasn’t, I swear. I swear!

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Rover, you shouldn’t swear in church -

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: And now all the Cat-pulets hate me, even Juliet! What am I going to do, Flyer? What am I ever going to do? Rover collapses in tears on the floor of the belfry. Flye looks down on him with irritation.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Come on, get up!  59.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: I can’t. Can’t you see? My life is over. Oh, woe is me! Flyer decides to try a little reverse psychology.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Why you’re nothing but a hound dog, crying all the time. Rover looks up at Flyer, slightly indignant.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: A hound dog?

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: There’s always hope, Rover. No matter how bleak things look. You just got to get up and keep trying.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: But what hope can there be for me now? At that instant Doc appears at the window above Rover and Flyer. She postures herself like a nightclub performer fr the 1940's.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: Hey ya big boys. Why you look so glum?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Doc! Rover leaps to his feet and rushes to the stairs below Do As he starts to scramble up, Doc yells sharply.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: Rover, stay where you are! Rover freezes and looks up at Doc confused.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: You’re ruining my big entrance. And with that, Doc saunters down the steps with her tail wrapped about her shoulders like a mink stole.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: I bring word from my lady.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: What oh what, tell me please! Does she hate me? Does she never want to see me again? Tell me, please, I have to know.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: Tell me something, do all dogs drool like that?  60. It’s all Rover can do to keep from ringing Doc’s neck.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: Ah quit your yelping. She loves you still.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: (ecstatic) She does?

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: And she knows Tyger had you set up.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: She does?

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: And she wants to see you as soon she can.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: She does?

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: She does. Rover scrambles toward the open window.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Then I’m going now!

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: Just a second! Rover pauses at the window.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: You aren’t going to go looking like that are you? For a golden retriever you’re looking a little tarnished.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Don’t you worry, Doc. Don’t you worry. Rover heads out of the belfry completely excited. EXT. BENEATH JULIET THE GIRL’S BALCONY - NIGHT Rover approaches the balcony thoroughly cleaned. He seems be on top of the world, until he remembers how high the balcony is. Seeing no other choice, he takes a few steps back and cha  61. toward the balcony. A few feet from the wall he makes a tremendous leap ... but only makes it about half way up a crashes back down to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Now what am I going to do? Truly starting to become dejected, Rover’s spirits change when he sees ROMEO APPROACH CARRYING A LADDER. Romeo places the ladder against the balcony and begins to up but then thinks of something and goes back down. Then begins to look for something in the garden. Rover takes advantage of the opportunity and scampers rig up the ladder. He is just about to steal into Juliet’s chamber when he turns and discovers Romeo picking flowers Juliet the Girl in the garden. Feeling like he needs to do the same for his Juliet, Rove goes back down the ladder. Down in the garden, Romeo sees Rover.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Oh loyal pooch. Have you a fair maiden of your own? Perchance a beagle? A collie? And must you stake your very life just to set eyes upon her? I think not. How much simpler it would be to be a lowly dog! Romeo scratches Rover behind the ears and heads back to t ladder with his bouquet. Once Romeo has gotten off the to Rover scrambles up behind him. Just as both Romeo and Rover are about to enter their respective entrances on the balcony, they are simultaneou overcome with a teenager’s sense of insecurity. Completely unaware that the other is doing the same thing the same time, both the dog and the boy look at their reflections in the window and fix their hair. Then they flex their biceps and blow into their hand/paw check for bad breath. Finally convinced that all is in order, the lovers puff up their chests and make their dashingly romantic entrances. INT. JULIET THE GIRL’S BEDROOM Both Juliet and Juliet the Girl are primping themselves a the door to the balcony opens. The male lovers swagger in Juliet sees Rover ... Juliet the Girl sees Romeo ... Both sets of lovers jump into each other’s arms! INT. JULIET THE GIRL’S BEDROOM - DAYBREAK Romeo and Juliet the Girl lay in one another’s arms on th love seat. Meanwhile, underneath the bed, Rover and Julie do exactly the same thing.  62. After a moment, we hear A BIRD CALL. ROVER AND JULIET’S POV Romeo’s legs come off the bed and move to the window. A moment later we hear the CURTAINS TORN OPEN and the room fills with light.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE BED
dialogues.text: Rover looks at Juliet, panicked at how late it’s gotten. Pecking her on the cheek he gets up to go. Juliet grabs h desperately just as ...

dialogues.speaker: JULIET THE GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wilt thou be gone? It is not yet day. Juliet squeezes Rover so tightly he begins to turn blue! It's like she’s put a VICE around his neck ...

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I must be gone and live ... Finally he breaks through Juliet’s clutches and catapults across the room, knocking over an expensive lamp!

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: «+. or stay and die. ABOVE ... Romeo and Juliet the Girl are so enamored of one another they haven’t noticed the lamp crash to the ground. BELOW ... Juliet has pounced on Rover again. He points out the wind desperately to the rising sun ...

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘Tis the morn. Look love ... Juliet shakes her head and closes her eyes, childishly refusing to acknowledge the morning.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET THE GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yond light is not day-light. Suddenly, Juliet radically shifts tactics, lifting up the blanket and casting a FLIRTATIOUS LOOK Rover's way.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET THE GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Therefore stay yet, - thou need’st not to be gone. This is too much for Rover to resist and he dives under t covers to be with Juliet.  63.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let me be put to death! Juliet wills it so. It is not day. Suddenly Juliet is FRANTIC to get Rover out of the bedroo Only now Rover clings to Juliet!

dialogues.speaker: JULIET THE GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It is, it is, - hie hence be gone, away! She pushes Rover toward the window RIPPING up the bedshee KNOCKING over the vanity table, and SMASHING the chest of drawers. In addition, the canopy from the bed has gotten caught on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: chandelier ... Romeo and Juliet The Girl, meanwhile, still have ABSOLUTE NO IDEA the room is being literally DEMOLISHED!

dialogues.speaker: JULIET THE GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: --. O, now be gone; more light and light it grows. The Nurse and Doc enter simultaneously. Doc stares at the destruction around her.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Your lady mother is coming to your chamber: The day is broke;

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: (to herself) So’s the lamp ...

dialogues.speaker: NURSE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Be wary! Look about! The chandelier crashes to the ground! ... narrowly missin all of the lovers, who are STILL oblivious to the room be destroyed. They can only look deeply into one another’s eyes ... Finally, dramatically, Juliet the Girl opens the window.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET THE GIRL
dialogues.text: Then window, let day in, and let life out.

dialogues.speaker: ROMEO
dialogues.text: Farewell, farewell! One kiss and I’1l descend. Both pairs of lovers kiss simultaneously. Then Rover and Romeo head out the window and disappear into the street. Juliet and Juliet the Girl watch them go sadly. Finally, Juliet the Girl notices that Juliet is there.  64.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET THE GIRL
dialogues.text: Oh Kitty Juliet, alack the day! Have you a dashing prince far hence? Some Siamese cat? Some Noble Persian? It must be so much simpler to be a cat. Both crying now, Juliet and Juliet the girl comfort one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover has breakfast with the pigs at their trough.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: I don’t know how you fellas eat this slop.

dialogues.speaker: PIG
dialogues.text: You get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Those scraps in the piazza are looking pretty good now. Sure wish I was back home ... (Sighs) ++. with Juliet. The pigs look at Rover sympathetically for a moment, then return to their slop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover walks inside and finds the barn empty. Confused, he BARKS.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Romeo? Where are ya, Romeo? Rover then finds Romeo’s red feathered cap. His human fri is gone. INT. JULIET’S ROOM Juliet curls up by the window, looking out at the falling rain. She is still quite sad. Doc saunters in.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: Are you planing on being miserable forever?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I miss him, Doc. I miss him more and more each day. And to make matters worse, Juliet’s gone too. I haven’t seen her for days.  65.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: You know how humans get when they’re in love. They can’t think about anything else.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I’m starting to understand why.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: You gotta snap out of this, kid. Your folks are real worried about you. I heard they’re even going to ...

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: They're going to what, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: They're going to ask ... Just then, Lord and Lady Cat-Pulet enter, followed by Vie the snobby Viennese cat from the party.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: -.. Vienna to marry you. Vienna bows before Juliet and kisses her paw.

dialogues.speaker: VIENNA
dialogues.text: Juliet, how purr-fect you look! Alarmed, Juliet looks at Doc.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Oh no ...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover lies alone in the fields and HOWLS at the moon.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: First I lose my girl, then I lose my best friend. Could things get any worse? As if one cue, it begins to rain. Rover is soaked.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: They could ... He bows his head and begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Rover looks up and finds an adorable FEMALE, GOLDEN RETRI PUPPY standing by the farmer’s house.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Well, to be honest ... not really.  66.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PUPPY
dialogues.text: Why don’t you come inside? The farmer just put out some food. Rover’s tempted, but not sure.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PUPPY
dialogues.text: (Smiling) Come on. I won’t bite. Rover walks out of the fields and follows the cute puppy inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flyer is experimenting with different breath sprays when Juliet leaps into the the belfry.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Flyer!

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: You’re never going to believe what's happened!

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: My parents want me to get married with Vienna.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Well did you try to talk them out of it?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Of course I did. But they wouldn’t hear it. I can’t stand it how they treat me like I’m some kind of kitten! Flyer, what am I going to do?

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Flyer thinks for a moment. Then he shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Well, when in doubt ... Flyer flies down to the sanctuary below. Juliet leaps dow after him.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: When in doubt what?  67. Flyer comes across a vial, which contains a potion and si on the Friar’s lectern.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: When in doubt, do what people do.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Do what people do? What did they do?

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Well, believe it or not, this same situation is happening between Romeo and Juliet.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Can you imagine? What are the chances? And so when your Juliet came here just a little while ago, Friar Laurence gave her a potion like this which will make it seem like she has died -

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Died!

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Don’t be afraid. It will only seem that she has died. Really. Flyer picks up a piece of chalk and begins scrawling on a piece of slate like a coach diagramming a play.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: She’1ll just be sleeping. So then she won’t have to marry Paris. Because then her parents will think she’s dead, see? And who’d want to marry a dead person anyway, right? Is this making any sense?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I’m not sure ...

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Well, let me see if I got this straight. What’s really going to be happening is that Juliet’s just going to be sleeping The chalk figures that Flyer has drawn come to life and t to act out the elaborate plan. But they become as confuse as Juliet is becoming.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: --. and in forty two hours she’1l wake up good as new, and then Romeo will be there  68.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: CHALK FIGURES
dialogues.text: Yeah, how?

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: I don’t know how! Somehow, all right? And they’1ll go run off together and make a new life together ... in Mantua or somewhere. You got it? The Chalk Figures shake their heads vehemently. Juliet tu to Flyer tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: And you're saying this same plan would work for me and Rover?

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: That’s exactly what I’m saying.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I don’t know ...

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Well, it’s just it sounds so... dangerous. And so complicated. It just seems like there’s a lot of things that could go wrong.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It just doesn’t sound wise

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: But Friar Laurence said -

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Well who cares what Friar Laurence said -

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Because he’s human, that’s why! And everybody knows that humans are smarter than animals. And if they’ve made this plan ... well, it must be better than any (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLYER (cont'd) plan we could come up with. Don’t you think?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I guess so. Neither one of them seem too convinced of the wisdom of t plan, but Flyer puts the potion in front of Juliet anyway

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Now take this vial and get yourself back to your house and do exactly as I have said. You hear? Flyer opens his wings and starts flying toward the open window. FLYER (cont'd) I will fly now to Mantua to tell Rover of our plan! Juliet looks at the vial on the lectern. Finally she pick it up and turns to go. The Chalk Figures shake their head in disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: CHALK FIGURES
dialogues.text: You'll be sorry ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flyer flaps along panting rapidly. The two Doves fly near almost mocking how slowly the little bat struggles throug the air.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: I wish I was a bird. (Almost completely out of breath) I wish I was a bird. Suddenly, Flyer sees something below that literally stops in mid-air. FLYER (cont'd) Oh no! As Flyer zooms down to the ground, he becomes even more upset. FLYER (cont'd) No! Say it isn’t so! Flyer lands finally on the steps of a large marble struct called “The Monument of the Lovers”. There beside him lay the MOTIONLESS BODIES OF ROMEO AND JULIET THE GIRL. They embrace each other gently and seem almost to be sleeping. But the vial that lies beside Romeo’s outstretched hand a the knife beside Juliet the Girl let Flyer know that thes lovers will never wake up again.  70. The Doves look down on the scene from above. FLYER (cont'd) Did Romeo find Juliet sleeping and think --.? And so then he took this poison --.? And she ... waking up to find him dead ... did she ... take the knife and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flyer cries out loud. FLYER (cont'd) Oh how did this happen? How can this be? Flyer covers his head with his wings and sobs. The Doves look on from above. For the first time they begin to real that Flyer is more than just a scary little bat. Just as they start to come closer, a terrible realization spreads across Flyer’s face. FLYER (cont'd) But wait! If this happened to Romeo and Juliet, then the same thing could happen to ... He turns and looks back toward Verona. FLYER (cont'd) I’ve got to get back to Juliet and tell her not to take that potion! Setting off toward Verona, Flyer comes over a hill and is by sunlight. Once again his radar malfunctions and he spi out of control to the ground. FLYER (cont'd) Oh, how can it get any worse than this? The Doves look at one another, truly worried. INT. JULIET THE GIRL’S BEDROOM Juliet sits on Juliet the Girl’s bed considering Flyer’s POTION. The Chalk Figures hover nearby.

dialogues.speaker: CHALK FIGURES
dialogues.text: Don’t do it! You know it doesn’t make sense - But she starts to drink it anyway. As she tips the vial higher, she sees herself in the mirror. Suddenly she stop drinking and looks herself in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Juliet, what are you doing? Of course this doesn’t make sense. But the potion starts to take effect. Just as she falls unconscious she sets the vials on the floor.  71. We see now, she has only drank HALF OF THE POTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flyer is trying to do anything he can to see in the light he can fly off to Verona again. He even tries flying with seeing-eye-stick, only to come crashing down to the earth He ends up wrapped in thick vines, nearly unable to move all.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s no good. I’11 never be able to see in the light! Flyer’s head droops as he realizes there’s no hope. But not too far away, the Doves look down, touched by Fly determination to help Rover and Juliet. Finally they must the courage to fly down to him. A moment later they have begun to peel away the vines. FLYER (cont'd) Hey! Hey! What are you doing? Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: DOVES
dialogues.text: Shhh. Squinting to make out who it is, Flyer begins to understa

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: What? Are you here ... to help me? The Doves nod. FLYER (cont'd) Me? Scary Flyer? His answer is to be lifted gently into the air. The Doves one on each of Flyer’s wing, take him higher and higher a head off toward Verona. INT. JULIET THE GIRL’S BEDROOM Lady and Lord Cat-pulet and Doc come into the room. Doc i carrying a beautiful white wedding dress. Juliet lies motionless on Juliet The Girl’s pillow.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: Juliet? Look, darlin’. Look what I made of the sheets you tore up. (Observing her more closely) Juliet?

dialogues.speaker: LADY CAT-PULET
dialogues.text: Juliet, wake up!

dialogues.speaker: LORD CAT-PULET
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with her?  72.

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: LADY CAT-PULET
dialogues.text: Is she ...? Is she ...? As Lady Cat-Pulet looks closer and closer at her daughter she begins to realize that something is truly wrong. EXT. JULIET’S BALCONY - LATER Doc lies on the stone wall, weeping. The rats, on their w out of the sewer, feel her tear drops land on their tiny heads. They look up.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST RAT
dialogues.text: What’s with the waterworks, Doc?

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: (Sobbing) My best friend is dead.

dialogues.speaker: RATS
dialogues.text: Juliet? Doc sobs and nods ‘yes.’

dialogues.speaker: FIRST RAT
dialogues.text: That’s terrible.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND RAT
dialogues.text: She was so young ...

dialogues.speaker: FIRST RAT
dialogues.text: So beautiful ...

dialogues.speaker: SECOND RAT
dialogues.text: And that’s saying a lot coming from a couple of rats.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST RAT
dialogues.text: Is there anything we can do?

dialogues.speaker: DOC
dialogues.text: You can tell all the animals. Tell them Juliet will be buried in the cat-a-combs at sunset.

dialogues.speaker: RATS
dialogues.text: We won’t let you down, Doc!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rats climb through holes in the walls of villas throughout Verona to tell domestic animals the news.  73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rats scurry through the square to tell all of the cit stray animals the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rats go from cage to cage. The elephant uses his trun to wipe the tears from his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rats peer through a window in the bell tower, but Fly is gone. Instead, the rats tell the pigeons perched atop cathedral. The pigeons, saddened, fly off.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST RAT
dialogues.text: Now all of Italy will know of Juliet’s passing ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rover tries to leave the farmer’s house, he is surroun by A LARGE FAMILY of golden retrievers.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PUPPY
dialogues.text: My family really likes you, Rover. The dogs lick and jump all over him.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: You think? The Female Puppy snuggles up to Rover.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PUPPY
dialogues.text: They think we make a great couple.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: (Surprised) A couple? All we did was share a can of Alpo. Just then, the pigs saunter by on their way to the trough

dialogues.speaker: FIRST PIG
dialogues.text: Such a pretty cat gone before her time.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PIG
dialogues.text: It’s rumored she died of a broken heart.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST PIG
dialogues.text: Seems to be happening a lot in Verona these days. Rover's curiosity is piqued.  74.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Pigs. Who are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PIG
dialogues.text: Haven’t you heard? Juliet Cat-Pulet is dead.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: (Shocked) What?!

dialogues.speaker: FIRST PIG
dialogues.text: Did you know her ...?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Know her? She was my wife.

dialogues.speaker: PIGS
dialogues.text: Your WIFE?!

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Which way back to Verona? The pigs point.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Farewell, farm animals. I must see my sweet Juliet one last time! Rover runs down the dirt road. The female puppy turns to mother.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PUPPY
dialogues.text: Why are all the cute dogs married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Doves and Flyer approach the city walls, the Doves the Pigeons from the cathedral flying sadly back toward t They decide to fly up to them to find out what’s wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover runs up to the entrance to the catacombs, completel out of breath. Because all his thoughts are on finding Juliet as quickly as possible, he doesn’t notice that Sha and Speare are keeping watch from across the street.

dialogues.speaker: SHAKE
dialogues.text: Zounds! Forsooth, wasn’t that the scoundrel Rover?

dialogues.speaker: SPEARE
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should exeunt stage left.

dialogues.speaker: SHAKE
dialogues.text: To Lord Tyger’s?  75.

dialogues.speaker: SPEARE
dialogues.text: Exactamundo! As Rover enters the catacombs, Shake and Speare laugh menacingly and head out to find Tyger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The catacombs are a dark and somber place. The tunnels go lower and lower, lit by spooky torches. Frightening tombstones and artifacts fill the entire place. Rover loo around, unsure which way to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercury and Benny are moping beside the river when a huge mass of angry cats, led by Shake and Speare and Tyger run over the bridge near them. Mercury swats Benny with his tail.

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: What do you think they’re up to?

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. But it can’t be anything good. Mercury and Benny head after the cat, whistling to other strays to come with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover is deeper in the catacombs choosing between two different passageways. It’s even spookier down here. It seems like a ghost could pop out at any moment.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Juliet? Oh, Juliet, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mercury and Benny look down at the entrance to the cataco amid a crowd of angry dogs. A second later the angry cats storm in the front door. Mercury and Benny look at one another confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Rover has reached the point of total frustration, turns a corner and sees a newly decorated tomb with the w “Juliet Cat-Pulet” written above it. MEANWHILE UPSTAIRS ... The cats have gathered for a pep-talk.  76.

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: Guys! The cats stand in line, shoulder to shoulder. Tyger addresses them like an all-star wrestler. He is so angry veins bulge out of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: We’re gonna crush him! Then we’re gonna mush him! And then we’re gonna flush him! A confused cat turns to another cat.

dialogues.speaker: CONFUSED CAT
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: The pooch you moron!

dialogues.speaker: SHAKE
dialogues.text: The pooch!

dialogues.speaker: SPEARE
dialogues.text: The pooch!

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: My kingdom for that pooch!! Shake turns to Speare.

dialogues.speaker: SHAKE
dialogues.text: He’s kind of getting the hang of this ...

dialogues.speaker: ALL THE CATS
dialogues.text: Charge! The cats scatter throughout the catacombs in a mad frenzy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doves finally get Flyer to the front door, setting hi gently on the front step.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: So she’s in here? The Doves nod pensively. Flyer opens the front door and looks in to the spooky catacombs.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Oooh. Dark. Spooky. Reminds me of home. (To the Doves) Care to join me? The Doves shake their heads and high-tail it.  77. INT. JULIET’S TOMB Rover solemnly approaches the tomb and finds Juliet laid on a golden pedestal. She looks lovely. Big tears come to Rover’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Oh Juliet. Look at you. There isn’t anything I wouldn’t give just to hear you purr once again. He kisses Juliet lightly on the cheek. Suddenly, Juliet begins to purr ever so softly. Rover looks at her complet shocked.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Juliet? Is that you? Why ... why you’re purring! Your whiskers are moving! Juliet opens her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Juliet, you are alive!

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Of course I am alive. They hug each other ecstatically! Then Rover looks at her again, unable to believe that his dream has come true.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: But ... but ... I don’t understand ... A wave of recognition spreads across Rover's face.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s true what they say about cats.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: That you have nine lives.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I only have one life, Rover. But I want to spend that life with you.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Then how did you ...

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I couldn’t do it. I just couldn’t drink all of that ... At that very moment, Tyger’s platoon turns the corner and sees Rover. Juliet, still back in her tomb, is not visibl to the charging cats.  78.

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: There he is! As the cats near, Rover turns to Juliet.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Come on! Juliet tries to get up but stumbles. Obviously, the potio has not completely worn off yet.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I can’t yet. Run! Rover looks at her longingly again. JULIET (cont'd) Rover, GO! Rover finally turns and sprints further down the passagew The cats are right behind him. Juliet tries to get their attention ... JULIET (cont'd) Tyger, guys! Stop... ... but Tyger is too focused on the chase, and Juliet is weak. The pursuit leaves her behind.

dialogues.speaker: IN ANOTHER PART OF THE CATACOMBS
dialogues.text: Flyer is soliciting help from some of his brethren who ha upside down in a passageway.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Hey Lenny. How’s it hanging?

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Not so bad.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: You know where Juliet’s tomb is? Lenny gestures with his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LENNY
dialogues.text: Thataway.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Thanks! MEANWHILE ... Rover is losing ground. The snarling pack of cats nip at heals as he ducks down yet another tunnel.  79.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE TOMB
dialogues.text: Flyer comes across Juliet who is now able to walk.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Juliet!

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Oh, Flyer, you gotta help me.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: They're trying to kill Rover!

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: My family! They went down there!

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE END OF THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Rover comes to a dead end. He’s trapped! The cats corner him against the wall. Tyger comes to the front of the pac

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: Well done, henchcats! Tyger practices elongating his nails as he did into the d board before.

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: Now we're going to have a little fun! Rover looks at Tyger’s nails and is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: JUST DOWN THE TUNNEL A LITTLE LATER
dialogues.text: Juliet and Flyer have found Rover and the pack. They hudd in the shadows and come up with a plan.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: You got it?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: You're not going to get scared?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: I’ll try.  80.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: All right then. Let’s go. At the end of the tunnel, the cats have Rover’s four limb pinned to the wall. A bulls-eye has been drawn on Rover's chest. Tyger stands behind a line drawn in the dirt and prepares to throw ... All of a sudden we hear a terrifyin screech! All the cats turn and see Flyer, who has converted himsel into a HORRIFYING VAMPIRE BAT! He bares his fangs and div in on the cats. They scatter in a flash. FLYER (cont'd) I vant to suck your blood! Tyger is the only cat who can keep his cool.

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: Guys, don’t panic. Bats don’t suck blood. They don’t!

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: I live with ghosts. I bring the dead back to life! Flyer now points over to Juliet, who walks into the group cats like a zombie and moans like a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Tyyyy-gerrrr .... Tyyyy-gerrrr ... This is too much for even the toughest cat. Tyger and the whole crew run for their lives.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Oh, Flyer, you did it! Flyer reverts to his adorable self.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Aw shucks ...

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: You see how much better plans work out if you make them yourself? She frees Rover and hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: I thought you said all that vampire stuff was untrue.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Well ... so I fibbed a little. Come on, lets get out of here. AT JULIET’S TOMB  81. Tyger discovers that Juliet is not there. A suspicious lo comes over his face. He heads upstairs at a quicker pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover opens a manhole and lets Juliet out. Just when the lovers think they’re home free ... now the dogs are after them. Mercury and Benny and their hoodlums surround Julie

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY
dialogues.text: Hey, we got ourselves a Cat-Pulet! (To Juliet) Don’t you know it’s not safe to be out alone? But Rover comes out of the manhole now and steps between friends and Juliet.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Mercury, don’t hurt her!

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY
dialogues.text: But she’s a cat!

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter if she’s a cat. This fight between our species has gone on long enough!

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY
dialogues.text: Why, you sound like ... like a cat lover! Rover looks at Juliet.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Perhaps I am.

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY
dialogues.text: Then in my book, you're as good as a cat.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: (Hurt) Mercury ...

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: (Turning to Mercury) Good as a cat? What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY
dialogues.text: I’m saying ... get them! All the dogs but Benny pounce after Rover and Juliet, but young lovers make a few elusive maneuvers and dash down t street. Benny trails behind the pack, almost hoping for Rover and Juliet. A moment later, Flyer comes out of the manhole only to discover that another chase is happening.  82.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Oh now come on! Isn’t this getting just a little bit ridiculous? But he flaps his way down the street to do what he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rover and Juliet are running down a narrow street, which turns into a dead end. Juliet, of course, leaps to a balc and then to a roof top. Rover is left below in the street And the dogs are closing in...

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Come on Rover! Jump!

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: I can’t! It’s too high!

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: No it’s not. Just ... just ... believe you are a cat.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Believe I am a cat?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: That’s all you’ll need. Trust me. Rover backs away from the wall to take a running start. Mercury and his thugs are closing in.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Believe I ama cat. Believe I am a cat. Rover starts running toward the wall.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Hurry, Rover!

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Meow, meow, meow ... Taking off just a few feet from the wall, Rover jumps hig into the air just as the dogs swipe at him and miss.

dialogues.speaker: MEEEEEEEEOWWWWWWWW
dialogues.text: And he soars almost magically through the air, landing on rooftop next to Juliet.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: You did it!

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: I did?  83.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: You did! The dogs bark below. In an instant Flyer has caught up to them.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Come on you guys! We’re not out of the woods yet. In fact, the woods have gotten even thicker! Rover’s hero leap to the rooftop has caught the eye of TYGER AND HIS G who were heading back to the Cat-Pulet house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now all the cats and all the dogs are chasing Rover and Juliet through town. As the commotion passes the Cat-Pule house and the Mongrel’s alley, Rover and Juliet’s parents join the chase. Pretty soon it seems like every animal in town is running after Rover and Juliet. They storm through markets, house gardens, restaurants, churches ... You name it! All of Verona is being turned upside down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, as Rover and Juliet run out onto the bridge, the CATS come up from one side and the DOGS from the other. Rover and Juliet are trapped! Flyer tries to get to them, put a dog swishes his tail, knocking Flyer headfirst into the muddy riverbank. A complete circle has been made around the lovers now. Th know they have nowhere to go. After a moment, Lady and Lo Cat-Pulet and Big Daddy and Mama Mongrel come to the fron They all stare at their children with disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: (To his parents) Don’t hurt her!

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: (To her parents) Don’t hurt him!

dialogues.speaker: LORD CAT-PULET
dialogues.text: What’s going on here?

dialogues.speaker: BIG DADDY MONGREL
dialogues.text: Yeah. What is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Well, the truth is ... Rover turns to Lady Cat-Pulet.  84.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Mom ...

dialogues.speaker: LADY CAT-PULET
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: (To Lord Cat-Pulet) Dad ...

dialogues.speaker: LORD CAT-PULET
dialogues.text: Dad?! (To Juliet) Juliet, what is the meaning of this?

dialogues.speaker: BIG DADDY MONGREL
dialogues.text: (Folding his paws) I'd really like to know myself.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: The truth is ... (Gulping) +.. we're married.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT
dialogues.text: The TWO MOTHERS instantly faint to the ground! All the do and cats square off with one another. A fight could break out at any second. The TWO FATHERS look at one another accusingly.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CAT-PULET
dialogues.text: This is all your fault, Mongrel!

dialogues.speaker: BIG DADDY MONGREL
dialogues.text: Well maybe if you knew how to lock up your daughter! Rover and Juliet restrain their fathers.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Stop! Please!

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Can’t you see that this fighting between us dogs and cats is ridiculous?

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: All you have to do is just ...open your eyes ... Lady Cat-Pulet and Mama Mongrel, who have fallen side by side, regain consciousness and look one another in the ey JULIET (cont'd) ++. and look at each other ...  85. Lord Cat-Pulet and Big Daddy Mongrel turn and look at one another too. In fact, every dog on the bridge turns and looks at the cat he or she was about to fight with. JULIET (cont'd) ++. you would see ... The tension on the bridge begins to ease. All the dogs an cats reach out to one another, much like a person looking himself in the mirror. JULIET (cont'd) We're really very much alike. Doc and Benny gaze at one another. So do the mothers ... JULIET (cont'd) Much more alike than we are different ... Unfortunately, Tyger and Mercury aren’t so enchanted by t sudden inter-species love-fest. They look at one another distrustfully. As their paws come out to touch ... Tyger elongates his nails right into Mercury's eyes!

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: Bulls-eye! Mercury reels back in pain. A dark look of fury spreads across his face ... TYGER (cont'd) Or should I say, “Dogs-eye”? Benny sees that Mercury’s getting COMPLETELY STEAMED.

dialogues.speaker: BENNY
dialogues.text: Mercury, no! But it’s too late. Mercury jumps on Tyger, starting a ful out brawl! Dogs and cats are jumping in from everywhere n Rover and Juliet try to get things calmed down again ...

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Guys, stop!

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Don’t, please! But it’s no use. SCREECHES and GROWLS are heard coming fr every direction. Dog and cat limbs emerge from a growing puff of smoke. Juliet ends up getting knocked down and nearly trampled. Rover runs to her. ROVER (cont'd) Juliet!  86.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Oh, Rover. They look around themselves. Their worst nightmare has co to pass. They hold each other, on the verge of tears. Flyer meanwhile, has finally extracted himself from the m He flies up to the bridge a completely unrecognizable blo Looking down on the battle below, Flyer summons an almost supernatural strength, and bellows out an enormous yell.

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: All the animals turn and look. When Flyer finally shakes mud off himself and the animals see that he is a bat, the recoil in shocked fear. FLYER (cont'd) No! Don’t be afraid of me. Listen to me. But they don’t seem to want to listen. A few animals bolt into the woods. FLYER (cont'd) I’m not scary. I’m not... Suddenly from above, we hear a loud whistle. A second lat the two Doves flutter down and put their wings around Fly just as he had tried to put his wings around them earlier The other animals of Verona take this as a sign and begin grow less frightened of Flyer. FLYER (cont'd) We shouldn’t be so distrustful of each other. We shouldn’t be afraid of each other for no reason. Dogs ... cats ... any of us. You see what can happen? Flyer turns and points toward town. Romeo and Juliet’s funeral procession is making its way through the streets of Verona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the Montagues and Capulets march behind a veiled hear As the procession makes its way across the bridge, the animals part somberly and let it pass. FLYER (cont'd) Is that what we want to happen to us, too? Lord Cat-pulet and Big Daddy Mongrel look at one another a moment. Then they turn and begin following the processi All the other animals of Verona trail behind them as well

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral procession comes to a halt at the top of the hill. The entire city of Verona can be seen below.  87. As the cats and dogs follow Flyer, the procession of mour begins to part to each side, allowing Rover and Juliet to for the first time THE GRAVES OF ROMEO AND JULIET. Two tombstones bear the lovers’ names.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Romeo ...

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Juliet ... The Capulets and The Montagues lay red roses on each grav The families turn and look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CAPULET
dialogues.text: O brother Montague, give me thy hand ... Lord Montague and Lord Capulet take each other’s hand, wh their wives weep in each other’s arms. The Prince address both families.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: Never was a story of more woe, than that of Juliet and her Romeo ... The Prince and The Friar lead the two families back down hill. Once enemies, The Capulets and The Montagues are no joined in their sorrow. When the humans are gone, the dogs and cats approach the graves, encircling Rover and Juliet. Flyer hovers above t couple.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Cat-Pulets, Mongrels. Don’t make the same mistakes that the families of Romeo and Juliet made. Flyer hovers between the cats and dogs.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: This war between cats and dogs, what good is it? Can anyone even remember how it began? The cats and dogs scratch their heads.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: The time for peace has come. You’re one family now. Brought together by the love of Rover for Juliet, and Juliet for Rover. What possibly could be a better reason to forget your differences than that? Flyer nudges Rover with his wing.  88.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Rover ... (Whispering) Go make nice with your in-laws. Rover walks over to Lord Cat-Pulet.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Lord Cat-Pulet, I love your daughter very much and promise to always be good to her. Lord Cat-Pulet looks at his wife, then back at Rover.

dialogues.speaker: LORD CAT-PULET
dialogues.text: I never thought I’d be saying this toa mongrel, but ... Welcome to the family, son! Lord Cat-Pulet and Rover embrace. The cats meow and the d bark with joy.

dialogues.speaker: BIG DADDY
dialogues.text: (To Juliet) Come give your big daddy a hug! Juliet gets a giant hug from Big Daddy. Everyone is happy except for Tyger and Mercury. Flyer notices this and nudg them together.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Boys, don’t you have something you can say to each other? I mean you are brothers now. Tyger and Mercury try to think of something.

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: Like milk?

dialogues.speaker: MERCURY
dialogues.text: Gives me gas. Bones?

dialogues.speaker: TYGER
dialogues.text: Not a chance.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Well, this may take a while ... Big Daddy and Lord Cat-Pulet have their paws around each other’s shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: BIG DADDY
dialogues.text: Come. Let’s return to Verona. Together . The cats and dogs begin to walk down the hill. Then Big Daddy turns around and looks up at Flyer.  89.

dialogues.speaker: BIG DADDY
dialogues.text: Aren't you coming, Flyer? If it weren’t for you, none of this would be possible

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Hey, that’s true! Everyone looks up and agrees.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Three cheers for Flyer! Everyone CHEERS. Flyer turns bright red.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Come on now ... you’re making me blush!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are shocked as they watch the dogs and cats walk s by side through the city together. Rover and Juliet turn one another and smile. Flyer is above them, filled with j

dialogues.speaker: FLYER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well I guess we’re one up on ol’ William S. At least our story has a happy ending. And not just for the Cat-Pulets and The Mongrels ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Capulets are playing with their cats. Lady Capulet brings Juliet up to her face and smiles. Tyblat is pettin Doc.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The Capulets finally noticed their cats and found comfort in their company. It helped to make the lost of their daughter a little less painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Montague sees the Butcher yelling at Rover. He walks over, pays the Butcher for his steaks, and takes Rover in arms.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The same can be said of the Montagues. They hadn’t forgotten that Rover was their son’s favorite stray. INT. MONTAGUES’ VILLA - MONTAGE Rover lives in the lap of luxury. A SERVANT feeds him ste and a gold water bowl with his name on it.  90.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As a way of remembering Romeo, the family took Rover in and showered him with affection. They made a little puppy’s dream of living inside come true. Rover waits until the servant has gone, then lets the res his family in through the doggy door. FLYER (V.O.) (cont'd) So you see? Sometimes things turn out better than anyone could have ever expected. Oops, I just remembered. There’s one more page to this story ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cat-pulets and The Mongrels throw a huge bash. Outsid the gate, Juliet waits. A few seconds later, Rover shows

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late. It was filet mignon tonight.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: That's all right. I’ve got some great news. The Capulets are taking me on a trip with them to Rome.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Wow. That’s great. Just be careful around the Coliseum. I hear its crawling with bachelor cats.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Ooh ... jealous?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: A little. Juliet snuggles close to Rover.

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Ready. They kiss and walk into the party. Just then ...

dialogues.speaker: SURPRISE
dialogues.text: A banner rolls down. It reads, ‘CONGRATULATIONS ROVER AND JULIET!’

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: It's a wedding reception!  91.

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: For us!

dialogues.speaker: JULIET
dialogues.text: Would you care to dance?

dialogues.speaker: ROVER
dialogues.text: Absolutely ... The Penguin orchestra plays their song. Juliet and Rover joined by other cats and dogs dancing together. Flyer hovers above and watches the joyous celebration. A moment later, he hears somebody cooing for him. Flyer tur and finds a PRETTY FEMALE DOVE smiling and giving him the eye.

dialogues.speaker: FLYER
dialogues.text: Ah, Verona! What a town! And they sail off into the starry night.
